intro: Monoon australe, commonly known as the Australian monoon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. It has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Monoon australe is often used in coastal landscaping due to its hardiness and aesthetic appeal.
